docs.lead_paragraph: Four cases of smallpox have occurred within a month in the tenement house at 1,294 First Avenue, and the health authorities knew nothing whatever about them until Friday, when a Yorkville physician wrote them that little Mary Volk, the oneyear-old daughter of a cigarmaker, had the disease.

headline.main: SMALLPOX KEPT CONCEALED.; Four Cases in a Tenement House -- A Mother Flees with Her Afflicted Child.
